this song is dedicated to ms. miranda a.k.a. mrs. buan...ü
hope u guys like it...
this is easy to understand...just pluck the strings by this order... 
4th 3rd 2nd 1st 2nd 3rd 1st 2nd


[Intro]

[ch]A[/ch]  [ch]AM7[/ch]  [ch]A7[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]  [ch]Dm6[/ch]  [ch]E7[/ch]


[Lyrics]

     [ch]A[/ch]                [ch]AM7[/ch]                 [ch]A7[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]
if a picture paints a thousand words then why can't i paint you?
    [ch]Dm[/ch]               [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]Dm6[/ch]                [ch]E7[/ch]
the words will never show the you i've come to know
     [ch]A[/ch]                   [ch]AM7[/ch]                 [ch]A7[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
if a face could launch a thousand ships the where am i to go?
         [ch]Dm[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]Dm6[/ch]                [ch]E7[/ch]
there's no one home but you, you're all that's left me to
     [ch]F#m[/ch]    [ch]F#m/F[/ch]   [ch]F#m/E[/ch]         [ch]D[/ch] 
and when my love for    life is running dry
     [ch]Em/C#[/ch]    [ch]F#7[/ch]   [ch]Bm7[/ch]        [ch]E7[/ch]
you come and pour yourself on me
      [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]AM7[/ch]             [ch]A7[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]
if a man could be two places at one time i'd be with you
  [ch]Dm[/ch]          [ch]A[/ch]      [ch]Dm6[/ch]               [ch]E7[/ch]
tomorrow and today beside you all the way
     [ch]A[/ch]                        [ch]AM7[/ch]             [ch]A7[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]
if the world should stop revolving spinning slowly down to die
     [ch]Dm[/ch]                 [ch]A[/ch]     [ch]Dm6[/ch]             [ch]E7[/ch]
i'd spend the end with you and when the world was through
     [ch]F#m[/ch]    [ch]F#m/F[/ch]   [ch]F#m/E[/ch]         [ch]D[/ch] 
then one by one the     stars would all go out
       [ch]Em/C#[/ch] [ch]F#7[/ch]      [ch]Bm7[/ch]    [ch]E7[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch] [ch]D[/ch] [ch]Dm6[/ch] [ch]A[/ch]
then you and i would simply fly away...

content.text:
[Intro]
[ch]D[/ch] [ch]Dmaj7[/ch] [ch]D7[/ch] [ch]G[/ch] [ch]Gm[/ch] [ch]A7[/ch] [ch]D[/ch]

[Verse]
     [ch]D[/ch]                [ch]Dmaj7[/ch]
If a picture paints a thousand words,
     [ch]D7[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]
then why can't I paint you?
    [ch]Gm[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]         [ch]Em[/ch]               [ch]A7[/ch]
The words will never show, the you I've come to know.

[Verse]
     [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]Dmaj7[/ch]
If a face could launch a thousand ships,
     [ch]D7[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]
then where am I to go?
        [ch]Gm[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]
There's no one home but you,
       [ch]Em[/ch]                 [ch]A7[/ch]
you're all that's left me too.

    [ch]Bm[/ch]      [ch]F#m[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]               [ch]Em[/ch]
And when my love for life is running dry,
    [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]B7[/ch]       [ch]Em[/ch]      [ch]A7[/ch]
you come and pour yourself on me.

     [ch]D[/ch]                [ch]Dmaj7[/ch]           [ch]D7[/ch]
If a man could be two places, at one time,
            [ch]G[/ch]
I'd be with you.
[ch]Gm[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]Em[/ch]               [ch]A7[/ch]
Tomorrow and today, beside you all the way.

[Verse]
       [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]Dmaj7[/ch]               [ch]D7[/ch]             [ch]G[/ch]
If the world should stop revrolving, spinning slowly down to die
    [ch]Gm[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]
I'd spend the end with you,
    [ch]Em[/ch]                 [ch]A7[/ch]
and when the world was through

     [ch]Bm[/ch]     [ch]F#m[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]                  [ch]Em[/ch]
Then one by one, the stars would all go out,
     [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]B7[/ch]      [ch]Em[/ch]       [ch]A7[/ch]   [ch]D[/ch]
then you and I would simply fly a way

[Outro]
[ch]D[/ch] [ch]Dmaj7[/ch] [ch]G[/ch] [ch]Gm[/ch] [ch]D[/ch] [ch]Dmaj7[/ch]

             CHORD SHEET BY ANTHONY JOHNSON


These chords are played by picking the 4th and 1st string at the same time 
then the 2nd 3rd 1st 2nd 3rd 1st strings.  On E7 the 5th and 1st are played together.
As you play the last "A" all strings are strummed top to bottom slowly 

This is my best interpretation of this song.
